content:
PlayReadyPlayRight PlayReadyPlayRight Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.ContentKeyAuthorization
Assembly:
Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.dll

Configures the Play Right in the PlayReady license. This right allows the client to play back the content and is required in license templates.

Edit

In this Article

[DataContract(Namespace = "http://schemas.microsoft.com/Azure/MediaServices/KeyDelivery/PlayReadyTemplate/v1")]
public class PlayReadyPlayRight : IExtensibleDataObject<DataContract(Namespace:="http://schemas.microsoft.com/Azure/MediaServices/KeyDelivery/PlayReadyTemplate/v1")>
Public Class PlayReadyPlayRight
    Implements IExtensibleDataObject
Inheritance
ObjectObject
PlayReadyPlayRightPlayReadyPlayRight
Attributes
DataContractAttribute

Inherited Members

System.Object

ToString()ToString()
Equals(Object)Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)Equals(Object, Object)

GetHashCode()GetHashCode()
GetType()GetType()
MemberwiseClone()MemberwiseClone()

Properties

AgcAndColorStripeRestriction AgcAndColorStripeRestriction

Edit

Configures Automatic Gain Control (AGC) and Color Stripe in the license. These are a form of video output protection. For further details see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public AgcAndColorStripeRestriction AgcAndColorStripeRestriction { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property AgcAndColorStripeRestriction As AgcAndColorStripeRestriction
Value
AgcAndColorStripeRestriction AgcAndColorStripeRestriction
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

AllowPassingVideoContentToUnknownOutput AllowPassingVideoContentToUnknownOutput

Edit

This property configures Unknown output handling settings of the license. These settings tell the PlayReady DRM runtime how it should handle unknown video outputs. For further details see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public UnknownOutputPassingOption AllowPassingVideoContentToUnknownOutput { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property AllowPassingVideoContentToUnknownOutput As UnknownOutputPassingOption
Value
UnknownOutputPassingOption UnknownOutputPassingOption
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

AnalogVideoOpl AnalogVideoOpl

Edit

Specifies the output protection level for analog video. Valid values are null, 100, 150, and 200. When the property is set to null, the output protection level is not set in the license. For further details on the meaning of the specific value see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public int ? AnalogVideoOpl { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property AnalogVideoOpl As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

CompressedDigitalAudioOpl CompressedDigitalAudioOpl

Edit

Specifies the output protection level for compressed digital audio. Valid values are null, 100, 150, 200, 250, and 300. When the property is set to null, the output protection level is not set in the license. For further details on the meaning of the specific value see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public int ? CompressedDigitalAudioOpl { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property CompressedDigitalAudioOpl As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

CompressedDigitalVideoOpl CompressedDigitalVideoOpl

Edit

Specifies the output protection level for compressed digital video. Valid values are null, 400, and 500. When the property is set to null, the output protection level is not set in the license. For further details on the meaning of the specific value see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public int ? CompressedDigitalVideoOpl { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property CompressedDigitalVideoOpl As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

DigitalVideoOnlyContentRestriction DigitalVideoOnlyContentRestriction

Edit

Enables the Digital Video Only Content Restriction in the license. This is a form of video output protection which requires the player to output the video portion of the content over Digital Video Outputs. For further details see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public bool DigitalVideoOnlyContentRestriction { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property DigitalVideoOnlyContentRestriction As Boolean
Value
Boolean Boolean
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

ExplicitAnalogTelevisionOutputRestriction ExplicitAnalogTelevisionOutputRestriction

Edit

Configures the Explicit Analog Television Output Restriction in the license. This is a form of video output protection. For further details see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public ExplicitAnalogTelevisionRestriction ExplicitAnalogTelevisionOutputRestriction { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property ExplicitAnalogTelevisionOutputRestriction As ExplicitAnalogTelevisionRestriction
Value
ExplicitAnalogTelevisionRestriction ExplicitAnalogTelevisionRestriction
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

ExtensionData ExtensionData

Edit 
public virtual ExtensionDataObject ExtensionData { get; set; }Public Overridable Property ExtensionData As ExtensionDataObject
Value
ExtensionDataObject ExtensionDataObject
Attributes
DataContractAttribute

FirstPlayExpiration FirstPlayExpiration

Edit

Specifies the amount of time that the license is valid after the license is first used to play content.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public TimeSpan? FirstPlayExpiration { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property FirstPlayExpiration As TimeSpan?
Value
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

ImageConstraintForAnalogComponentVideoRestriction ImageConstraintForAnalogComponentVideoRestriction

Edit

Enables the Image Constraint For Analog Component Video Restriction in the license. This is a form of video output protection which requires the player constrain the resolution of the video portion of the content when outputting it over an Analog Component Video Output. For further details see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public bool ImageConstraintForAnalogComponentVideoRestriction { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property ImageConstraintForAnalogComponentVideoRestriction As Boolean
Value
Boolean Boolean
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

ImageConstraintForAnalogComputerMonitorRestriction ImageConstraintForAnalogComputerMonitorRestriction

Edit

Enables the Image Constraint For Analog Computer Monitor Restriction in the license. This is a form of video output protection which requires the player constrain the resolution of the video portion of the content when outputting it over an Analog Computer Monitor Output. For further details see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public bool ImageConstraintForAnalogComputerMonitorRestriction { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property ImageConstraintForAnalogComputerMonitorRestriction As Boolean
Value
Boolean Boolean
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

ScmsRestriction ScmsRestriction

Edit

Configures the Serial Copy Management System (SCMS) in the license. SCMS is a form of audio output protection. For further details see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public ScmsRestriction ScmsRestriction { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property ScmsRestriction As ScmsRestriction
Value
ScmsRestriction ScmsRestriction
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

UncompressedDigitalAudioOpl UncompressedDigitalAudioOpl

Edit

Specifies the output protection level for uncompressed digital audio. Valid values are 100, 150, 200, 250, and 300. When the property is set to null, the output protection level is not set in the license. For further details on the meaning of the specific value see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public int ? UncompressedDigitalAudioOpl { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property UncompressedDigitalAudioOpl As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

UncompressedDigitalVideoOpl UncompressedDigitalVideoOpl

Edit

Specifies the output protection level for uncompressed digital video. Valid values are null, 100, 250, 270, and 300. When the property is set to null, the output protection level is not set in the license. For further details on the meaning of the specific value see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public int ? UncompressedDigitalVideoOpl { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property UncompressedDigitalVideoOpl As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

Configures the Play Right in the PlayReady license.  This right allows the client to play back the content
and is required in license templates.
